member.summary: Provides configuration information for a network interface.

member.summary: Gets the NetworkInterface object.

member.summary: Gets the type of the network servicing Internet requests.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType
member.summary: An enumeration of network types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.None
member.summary: There is no network available for accessing the internet.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.AsymmetricDsl
member.summary: The network interface uses an Asymmetric Digital Subscriber Line (ADSL).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Atm
member.summary: The network interface uses asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) for data transmission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.BasicIsdn
member.summary: The network interface uses a basic rate interface Integrated Services Digital Network (ISDN) connection. ISDN is a set of standards for data transmission over telephone lines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Ethernet
member.summary: The network interface uses an Ethernet connection. Ethernet is defined in IEEE standard 802.3.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Ethernet3Megabit
member.summary: The network interface uses an Ethernet 3 megabit/second connection. This version of Ethernet is defined in IETF RFC 895.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.FastEthernetFx
member.summary: The network interface uses a Fast Ethernet connection over optical fiber and provides a data rate of 100 megabits per second. This type of connection is also known as 100Base-FX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.FastEthernetT
member.summary: The network interface uses a Fast Ethernet connection over twisted pair and provides a data rate of 100 megabits per second. This type of connection is also known as 100Base-T.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Fddi
member.summary: The network interface uses a Fiber Distributed Data Interface (FDDI) connection. FDDI is a set of standards for data transmission on fiber optic lines in a local area network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.GenericModem
member.summary: The network interface uses a modem.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.GigabitEthernet
member.summary: The network interface uses a gigabit Ethernet connection and provides a data rate of 1,000 megabits per second (1 gigabit per second).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.HighPerformanceSerialBus
member.summary: The network interface uses a High Performance Serial Bus.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.IPOverAtm
member.summary: The network interface uses the Internet Protocol (IP) in combination with asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) for data transmission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Isdn
member.summary: The network interface uses a connection configured for ISDN and the X.25 protocol. X.25 allows computers on public networks to communicate using an intermediary computer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Loopback
member.summary: The network interface is a loopback adapter. Such interfaces are often used for testing; no traffic is sent over the wire.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.MultiRateSymmetricDsl
member.summary: The network interface uses a Multirate Digital Subscriber Line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Ppp
member.summary: The network interface uses a Point-To-Point protocol (PPP) connection. PPP is a protocol for data transmission using a serial device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.PrimaryIsdn
member.summary: The network interface uses a primary rate interface Integrated Services Digital Network (ISDN) connection. ISDN is a set of standards for data transmission over telephone lines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.RateAdaptDsl
member.summary: The network interface uses a Rate Adaptive Digital Subscriber Line (RADSL).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Slip
member.summary: The network interface uses a Serial Line Internet Protocol (SLIP) connection. SLIP is defined in IETF RFC 1055.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.SymmetricDsl
member.summary: The network interface uses a Symmetric Digital Subscriber Line (SDSL).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.TokenRing
member.summary: The network interface uses a Token-Ring connection. Token-Ring is defined in IEEE standard 802.5.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Tunnel
member.summary: The network interface uses a tunnel connection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Unknown
member.summary: The interface type is not known.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.VeryHighSpeedDsl
member.summary: The network interface uses a Very High Data Rate Digital Subscriber Line (VDSL).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Wireless80211
member.summary: The network interface uses a wireless LAN connection (IEEE 802.11 standard).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.MobileBroadbandGsm
member.summary: The network interface uses a GSM cellular network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.MobileBroadbandCdma
member.summary: The network interface uses a CDMA cellular network.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType
member.summary: An enumeration that contains asynchronous errors sent from the Push Client to the application. These error values can occur regardless of if the application is running in the foreground or not.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.ChannelOpenFailed
member.summary: This error is returned when the Push Client and the Push Notification Service are unable to establish a connection. For more information on how to set up a notification channel, see How to: Set Up a Notification Channel for Windows Phone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.PayloadFormatError
member.summary: This error is returned when the XML payload format or the HTTP header of the push notification is syntactically invalid. When this error is returned, the HTTP channel is disconnected and the channel must be reopened. Additionally, if your tile is bound to this notification channel, the tile will revert to your application's default tile.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.MessageBadContent
member.summary: This error is returned when the image reference is pointing to an HTTP image, even though the notification channel is not currently bound to a list of URIs. If your tile is bound to this notification channel, the tile will revert to your application's default tile.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.NotificationRateTooHigh
member.summary: This error is returned when the Push Client is unable to receive messages because the web service is sending too many messages at too quick a rate to a certain device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelErrorType.PowerLevelChanged
member.summary: This error is returned when the Push Client's power policy changes due to a change in battery level. For more information, see Power Management and Push Notifications for Windows Phone. If your tile is bound to this notification channel, the tile will revert to your application's default tile.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelPowerLevel
member.summary: The additional data associated with the message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelPowerLevel.NormalPowerLevel
member.summary: The battery capacity is not low. All push notification types will be sent to the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelPowerLevel.LowPowerLevel
member.summary: The battery capacity is low. Only raw notifications will be sent to the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Phone.Notification.ChannelPowerLevel.CriticalLowPowerLevel
member.summary: The battery capacity is critically low. No push notifications of any type will be sent to the device.
